person.persName: Daniel Price White (Provisional Congress of the Confederate States)

body.p: A Kentucky physician, farmer, businessman, soldier, and politician. Educated at Centre College and graduated from the Transylvania University Medical Department in 1827. Practiced medicine in Greensburg, Kentucky from 1827 to 1839. Married to Nancy F. Clark White. Father of Irene E. White, William P. White, Daniel P. White, Jr., R. A. White, and Aylett White. Owned twelve enslaved persons in 1860. Switched careers to farming and business. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1847 to 1859. Served as Speak of the House in the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1857 to 1859. Returned to farming in Christian County from 1853 to 1861. Served as a delegate to the 1860 Democratic National Convention in Baltimore Maryland and voted for Stephen A. Douglas. Canvassed and served as an elector-at-large for Stephen A. Douglas in the 1860 Presidential Election. Following the election of Abraham Lincoln, he moved enslaved persons to Yell County, Arkansas. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862 for six weeks. Served as a volunteer surgeon for Confederate soldiers in the field from 1862 to 1865. Returned to Kentucky and relocated to Louisville, Kentucky in the tobacco warehousing business.
